summary: Ernestine G. Johnson was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). She is mentioned in multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from April 1978 to January 1979. These documents list her name, and in some cases, her social security number, position, and salary. The reports cover different accounting periods, indicating her continued employment with the committee during that timeframe.
significance: Ernestine G. Johnson's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. While the documents do not specify her exact role, her presence on payroll and certification reports indicates she was a staff member involved in the committee's operations during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
